name: Help for Character for Lord of the Rings PVM server

posts.author: mr.estivi91
posts.content:
I need help to create a character lvl 40 with an elevated AB and also an elevated AC or failing that with great immunities and resistance to damage, there are +10 objects with object craftsmanship, hostile enemies have attack initiators of +80.
I have tried different characters in this forum, but none of them has finished arranging well on this server.

Critics are almost useless at the end of the game as are sneak attacks, so I need a high AB and the highest amount of hitting per round or something like that.
If there are any of these characteristics I already would appreciate the link ^^ since I have literally spent hours looking at guides in this forum, but I cannot find something feasible for this server, I chose 6 and applied them, but the final bosses did not even hit them and they kill me with 3 blows ^^

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
Your opponents have AB 80+?
That is a problem to cope with. How hard do they hit?
What AB do you need? Will taunt work?

Can you play caster?

Paladin/Wmaster w Taunt might be the Highest AB I can think of. Maybe Cleric/Weapon Master.
Will you get dispelled?

Dex get the best AC, and AB, but damage might be a problem depending on the opponents.

Team up with a tank type build, and going Arcane archer 29 or so.

Bard26/Fighter4/RDD10 maybe. Or cleric26/same. If you won't be debuffed, the more options open for buffer builds. Cleric16/Fighter2/Wmaster22. Or 17/4/19.

I don't know, probably need more info.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
With item levels that high there are multiple builds that can do well. The numbers below are rough calculations but they should give a decent idea of the AB/AC values that are possible, although if you don't minmax the AB/AC values will end up slightly lower. All of the builds except the Monk/AA can be built with Improved Expertise if more AC is needed.

I'll assume that +12 AB weapons, +8 AC items, and haste are available. Add +2 AC for however many +10 AC items are available.

STR Bard26/Pal4/RDD10: +66 AB (+6 Curse Song) (+6 Taunt) / 88 AC (+2 Curse Song)
STR Figh12/WM25/Rog3: +70 AB / 76 AC
DEX Monk10/Bard3/AA27: +78 AB / 86 AC
DEX Monk9/Cler26/SD5: +65 AB / 85 AC
STR Pal28/Bard2/RDD10: +75 AB / 88 AC
DEX Rog13/Figh8/WM19: +69 AB / 86 AC

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Without playing on your server I can't recommend a specific build for a beginner, since what works on some servers doesn't work on others.

Monk9/Cler26/SD5 is normally a decent beginner build on a server assuming that you know how to use the build properly. If you've never played a Cleric before you might struggle, but it has Epic Dodge and many useful spells to help in tough battles. It has +63 AB / 85 AC with Flurry Of Blows, or you can get +55 AB / 95 AC in Improved Expertise if you want to play defensively. In parties it can cover both healing and AC tanking which makes it very useful for party PvM.

Pal28/Bard2/RDD10 (or Pal26/Bard4/RDD10) requires a lot of buffing and you need to keep those buffs up during the fight. With IExp it has +65 AB / 98 AC when fully buffed, high saves, and immunity to Disease, Fear, Fire, and Paralysis. Mechanically it's one of the stronger choices but if you don't have much experience with a buffing playstyle it will be tough to adapt.

Rog13/Figh8/WM19 is the easiest of these three builds, you just point and click. With Improved Expertise it has +59 AB / 96 AC, plus it also has Epic Dodge as an additional defence. The Fortitude and Will saves are pretty low, but depending on your server this might not be a problem.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
A DEX dual-dagger Rogue 30 / Fighter 10 with Epic Dodge and Self Concealment 5 would be hard to hit, and the high enhancement damage on the weapons themselves would make up for the low STR damage.

A DEX dual-kama Monk 21 / Fighter 14 / SD 5 with Epic Dodge and Empty Body would also be hard to hit, and he would have even more attacks per round.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
mr.estivi91 wrote:
Jun 02, 2020
I need help to create a character lvl 40 with an elevated AB and also an elevated AC or failing that with great immunities and resistance to damage, there are +10 objects with object craftsmanship, hostile enemies have attack initiators of +80.
I have tried different characters in this forum, but none of them has finished arranging well on this server.

Critics are almost useless at the end of the game as are sneak attacks, so I need a high AB and the highest amount of hitting per round or something like that.
If there are any of these characteristics I already would appreciate the link ^^ since I have literally spent hours looking at guides in this forum, but I cannot find something feasible for this server, I chose 6 and applied them, but the final bosses did not even hit them and they kill me with 3 blows ^^
I am assuming your opponents are melee enemies with high AB and AC who hit like a truck particularly with crits?
With such opponents I think of- Issac's Greater Missile Storm (IGMS), Damage Shields (Mestil's Acid Sheath, Elemental Shield and others) and Pale-Master 10 (crit/sneak immunity).
One does not even try to beat the AC with ultra high AB or match the ultra high AB of enemies with ultra high AC, it could be futile and a "game of 1s and 20s" (auto hit on 20, auto miss on 1).
Its a different approach to what has been suggested so far. I know you have requested elevated AB and AC but it is just sounding very difficult, with some of the best builds you could find.

A wizard or sorcerer can spam 0-1-2-3 IGMS (standard, silent, empowered and maximised) if they are not magic damage resistant. 
If they have spell resistance, this can be lowered by 10 with Mord's if they are not a monk, or spell penetration feats could be added along with very high caster levels.
Four whole spell levels could do quite a lot of damage. 

Maybe even better, is a damage shield build approach. They are most effective against melee opponents that are not resistant to acid or fire. T
he best approach is to make an appropriate arcane caster and get palemaster 10 (PM 10) for crit and sneak immunity.
The alternative to PM 10 is casting extended shields then shapechanging into an Iron Golem with Shapechange. This has other problems however. 
Or Epic Warding, but this will only last for one battle.

The most famous damage shield PM builds are in my opinion Grizzled_Dwarflord's Mestil's builds (Pale Emissary and Half-Dead Juggernaut).
It doesn't matter that you can't hit them, because they hit you, and receive damage, and spell resistance doesn't matter in this situation. 
With CL 26 Mestils (1d6 + 52) and Elemental Shield (1d6+26) up, an opponent attacking you with 4 attacks / round will receive about 312 damage per round of acid and fire damage. 
Four opponents, about 1248 damage per round.
Other enemies (archers / casters) other spellcasting can be used, for example 0-1-2-3 IGMS, summons, Bigby's 6-7 to disable certain opponents.

This is Grizzled's own words (from Half-Dead Juggernaut):
This is a concept I explored before in the old classic, Mestil’s Pale Emissary, which seems like two lifetimes ago.  I took the same premise, but turned it upside down (to be honest, I was attempting to make a viable Gnome warrior build, and everything kept leading me back to Wizard, sigh).  But after all is said and done, I can’t help but think this could be a thing.  Unlike the Pale Emissary, you make no pretense at being a true caster.  But you still have a full compliment of Wizard Spells, undispellable, Epic Warding, Auto Silent III, Silenced, Empowered and Maximized IGMS, Immune to Crits, Dev Crits, Sneaks, Paralysis, 9/- DR.  But the true coup d'etat is the nearly 1000 hit points he gets when buffed with Empowered Endurance and some minor Con-boosting items, and then another 1300 hit points from Epic Warding, and with Damage Shields dealing nearly 100 points of damage per successful hit!  Drop this little bugger into a crowd and watch ‘em pop!  With an unbuffed Concentration at 66, no one will be able to Taunt or interrupt his castings, nor will anyone be able to Silence him.  Ladies, I present to you a build that should be both banned and outlawed:

[... build details and analysis...]

Finally, after playtesting, I think this build should be illegal in every regard in all PWs.  
Another approach is to group up and form a party but I presume you want to solo these guys.

I'll leave it at that for now, if trying to each ultra high AB / AC is too hard then a caster should be looked at.

This is a concept I explored before in the old classic, Mestil’s Pale Emissary, which seems like two lifetimes ago.  I took the same premise, but turned it upside down (to be honest, I was attempting to make a viable Gnome warrior build, and everything kept leading me back to Wizard, sigh).  But after all is said and done, I can’t help but think this could be a thing.  Unlike the Pale Emissary, you make no pretense at being a true caster.  But you still have a full compliment of Wizard Spells, undispellable, Epic Warding, Auto Silent III, Silenced, Empowered and Maximized IGMS, Immune to Crits, Dev Crits, Sneaks, Paralysis, 9/- DR.  But the true coup d'etat is the nearly 1000 hit points he gets when buffed with Empowered Endurance and some minor Con-boosting items, and then another 1300 hit points from Epic Warding, and with Damage Shields dealing nearly 100 points of damage per successful hit!  Drop this little bugger into a crowd and watch ‘em pop!  With an unbuffed Concentration at 66, no one will be able to Taunt or interrupt his castings, nor will anyone be able to Silence him.  Ladies, I present to you a build that should be both banned and outlawed:

[... build details and analysis...]

Finally, after playtesting, I think this build should be illegal in every regard in all PWs.  
Another approach is to group up and form a party but I presume you want to solo these guys.

I'll leave it at that for now, if trying to each ultra high AB / AC is too hard then a caster should be looked at.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
RE damage shields, this is a screenshot from playtesting of one of my build drafts I am working on (Sword of the Dracolich - I wouldn't recommend it in your situation but it can help illustrate how the shields work.) 
GDL might have some other comments to make too, I'd love to hear em.


The damage shield strategy is to deal more damage to them, when they hit you, than you receive.
It is pretty simple, cast the shield spells (death armor, elemental shield, mestil's acid sheath), have low AC (I have 13 AC in this screenshot) but high physical damage resistance/reduction, then let them hit you.
This is a level 10 sorcerer in the screenshot.
The green aura is Mestil's Acid Sheath. This does the most damage.
The yellow aura is Elemental Shield. This does fire damage, and grants 50% fire and cold immunity.
The black aura is Death Armor. This does the least damage but does magical damage, which is uncommonly resisted in most PvM modules.
The low AC my character has means the enemies hit me as often as possible.
To protect myself I have stoneskin active for +5 soak 10 and a swordsmans belt for slashing 5/-.
I have stoneskin on a wand to recast it when it soaks enough damage to disappear.
I have healing potions on the quickbar because I will need to heal quickly or I will die, in this screenshot I do not have crit/sneak immunity. When I get Pale Master 10 everything becomes easier.
GDL's build has epic damage reduction 9/- and epic warding 50-/20 for even more protection.
This fight against 10 opponents was over in less than 3 rounds, they basically killed themselves. 

GDL's damage shield build will deal close to 100 damage / hit to enemies, and is crit and sneak immune. Hopefully the enemies non-crit non-sneak damage is less than that amount, but even if it is more, its a better situation than not doing any damage to them at all, because you can't hit them on anything other than a 20, plus GDL's build can be hasted and cast two empowered/maximised IGMS per round to deal around 400-440 damage to them / round.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Dual kama  Monk 21 / Fighter 14 / SD 5  (It looks very good, how could that be developed, so that sneak attacks can be completely eliminated)
This build does not have any sneaks - it relies on HiPS (stealth), a high AB and lots of attacks per round (flurries) to deliver damage.

Vanilla True Sight will nerf this builds HiPS.

Before you go through the trouble of trying out a damage shield character, you should first find out if :

Those nasty critters have immunity to Acid, Fire, and/or Magical (or DR).  If they do (and they probably do - it's a pretty common thing to do to nerf damage shields), then it will save you the time of levelling such a build.

Also, check if those critters are using Mordenkainen's Disjunction (or Breach spells) - if they do, they will blow those shields right off.  Which will leave you standing there basically nekkid.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
It's possible that this is a gearing problem and not just a build problem. If your server is built around DI/DR but you only focus on AC then you will struggle even when fighting relatively easy mobs.

How much damage are these monsters doing to you and how much of that is physical or elemental? If you have any screenshots or combat logs from fights that would be useful, especially if you have a full text log of a fight.
You've said that Damage Resistance (up to 15/- or 20/- physical if lucky, up to 50/- elemental) exists on items but can you get Damage Immunity too?
Have you tried adding physical and elemental DR to your gear as well as AC?
Are there ways to heal yourself when fighting, such as Heal potions or scrolls?

The site says that weapons can get +2d12 damage bonuses, usually with damage bonuses that high most builds can do decent damage without critical hits or Sneak Attack. You haven't mentioned having trouble with your damage, just the damage from mobs. The Rog13/Figh8/WM19 has +7d6 Sneak Attack and WM crit bonuses, but even without those things it is still does a fair amount of damage for a DEX build when using highly enchanted weapons.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Is Damage Immunity available on items? Is concealment available (eg via Improved Invisibility)? Are there ways to heal yourself other than regeneration?
If the answer is no to these questions then you will struggle to solo these bosses.

The boss in the first screenshot (Smaug) has +88 AB, 50% Bludgeoning DI, Sneak Immunity, and does 75ish Physical damage. It has 46 AC or less when flatfooted but you can't judge the actual AC from this screenshot.
The boss in the second screenshot (El Rey de les Muertos) has +95 AB, at least 53 AC, 20/25% Bludgeoning DI, at least 12/- Bludgeoning DRes, at least 10/[+13 to -] DRed, 5/- Magical DRes, Sneak Immunity, a CL 40 Mestil's Acid Sheath, and does 95ish Physical damage.
The 100% Acid DI in the second screenshot is on mr.estivi91's character, not the boss.

Your current build and gear aren't really suited to your environment, you need more AB and a lot more HP. If you want to continue with that build you should drop your STR gear for CON/WIS gear and rebuild to have a higher CON. It also looks like you aren't at the +12 cap for abilities, try to fix that if possible. Consider carrying multiple weapons with different damage types so that you can choose the right weapon for the monster you're fighting.

Based on your screenshots this looks like a world designed around party PvM rather than solo PvM. A properly built tank (AC or DR) paired with a decent DPS build should be able to kill both of those bosses. Trying to solo will be difficult because the best tanks rarely have enough damage to kill before they get killed themselves. Something else to note is that with AB that high it's possible the bosses have +20 AB weapons, so Epic Warding might be useless.

A Monk9/Cler26/SD5 teamed up with one of the builds below should be able to kill those bosses.
Dru5/Shif13/DD22 (Risen Lord): 848 HP, 50% Piercing and Slashing DI, 24/- DRed.
Rog13/DD26/Figh1 or Rog13/DD26/Rang1: 81 AC (91 with IExp), 920 HP, Epic Dodge, 27/- DRed.
Rog19/Bard5/PM16: 99 AC (109 with IExp), 623 HP, Epic Dodge, Self Concealment 5.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Is Physical DI available as well as elemental DI? With just 25% DI and 15/- DRes you will reduce 100 damage to 60 damage, which should make soloing possible with the right build. I currently play on a server where the bosses do 300+ damage, but with the right build and gear it's possible to reduce that to 40-150ish damage depending on the boss. You're trying to solo mobs that seem to be designed for parties so you will need both a decent build and decent gear.

The invisibility effect from Improved Invisibility doesn't matter, the 50% concealment is what matters. Even if your opponent has Blind Fight they will still miss 25% of the time due to concealment. AC, concealment, and DI/DR are your main defences when fighting these sorts of mobs, if you only focus on AC then you will struggle to solo them.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Below is a minmaxed Rog13/Figh8/WM19, if you can get the right gear it should be able to solo some of the bosses. There are multiple other builds that should do well solo, but most of them either require buffing multiple abilities (eg Monk9/Cler26/SD5 and Pal28/Bard2/RDD10) or prior knowledge of the server (eg Rang26/Figh4/SD10).
In Improved Expertise the build has +59 AB, 96 AC (+1 with Dodge), and Epic Dodge. When combined with DI/DR and concealment this should be enough to go a few rounds before it requires healing.
There are several problems with the build, such as low Discipline and terrible saves, but it should be able to survive the actual combat. If saves are important on the server then you will need a different build.

In terms of gear you should be aiming for +12 DEX, +12 CON, at least +8 AC items, haste, 25% physical DI, 15/- physical DRes, some form of concealment, and some form of healing. The build has 40 UMD so you shouldn't have a problem using the staff.

Personally I dislike fully minmaxed builds, but in this case it's probably best to minmax first and then rebuild to be more balanced if you can afford to. If you do choose to rebuild it in the future, drop the starting DEX to 18 and swap some G DEX feats for other feats like ESF: Discipline, Epic Fortitude, or Epic Will.
Toughness is the only spare feat in the build if you minmax, I opted to ignore IC: Shortsword and Knockdown since critical immunity is common and knockdown probably won't work as a halfling. Maybe consider swapping it for a saves feat like Luck Of Heroes or Iron Will, but don't bother swapping it for a combat feat.
I chose shortsword for the weapon, but if you can't land crits then the only real difference between handaxe, mace, and shortsword is the damage type. I don't know which damage type is best for your server, so consider changing shortsword to another finessable weapon if you think that's best. It's also possible to drop feats to focus in two weapons, but I decided against it since I don't know if that's worth doing on your server.
There are a lot of spare skill points for this build so I invested in Set Trap and Spot. If there aren't any useful traps or if none of the mobs use stealth then you can drop them for something else.

Yunim wrote:
Jun 06, 2020
Below is a minmaxed Rog13/Figh8/WM19, if you can get the right gear it should be able to solo some of the bosses. There are multiple other builds that should do well solo, but most of them either require buffing multiple abilities (eg Monk9/Cler26/SD5 and Pal28/Bard2/RDD10) or prior knowledge of the server (eg Rang26/Figh4/SD10).
In Improved Expertise the build has +59 AB, 96 AC (+1 with Dodge), and Epic Dodge. When combined with DI/DR and concealment this should be enough to go a few rounds before it requires healing.
There are several problems with the build, such as low Discipline and terrible saves, but it should be able to survive the actual combat. If saves are important on the server then you will need a different build.

In terms of gear you should be aiming for +12 DEX, +12 CON, at least +8 AC items, haste, 25% physical DI, 15/- physical DRes, some form of concealment, and some form of healing. The build has 40 UMD so you shouldn't have a problem using the staff.

Personally I dislike fully minmaxed builds, but in this case it's probably best to minmax first and then rebuild to be more balanced if you can afford to. If you do choose to rebuild it in the future, drop the starting DEX to 18 and swap some G DEX feats for other feats like ESF: Discipline, Epic Fortitude, or Epic Will.
Toughness is the only spare feat in the build if you minmax, I opted to ignore IC: Shortsword and Knockdown since critical immunity is common and knockdown probably won't work as a halfling. Maybe consider swapping it for a saves feat like Luck Of Heroes or Iron Will, but don't bother swapping it for a combat feat.
I chose shortsword for the weapon, but if you can't land crits then the only real difference between handaxe, mace, and shortsword is the damage type. I don't know which damage type is best for your server, so consider changing shortsword to another finessable weapon if you think that's best. It's also possible to drop feats to focus in two weapons, but I decided against it since I don't know if that's worth doing on your server.
There are a lot of spare skill points for this build so I invested in Set Trap and Spot. If there aren't any useful traps or if none of the mobs use stealth then you can drop them for something else.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
You can change the race to elf but it will cause an XP penalty, you would need to use a tower shield instead of a large shield (+30 lbs), and you would lose 1 AB, 2 Fortitude, 1 Reflex, 1 Will, and 40 HP in exchange for +1 damage and Keen Sense. If you do go for an elf change the starting abilities from 8STR/14CON to 10STR/12CON, everything else is the same. Also change the weapon choice from handaxe/mace/shortsword to handaxe/mace/rapier if you go for elf. Even if most monsters are immune to critical hits that change will help slightly against the ones that aren't.

Handaxe (slashing) is 1d6 (x3), mace (bludgeoning) is 1d6 (x2), rapier (piercing) is 1d6 (18-20/x2), shortsword (piercing) is 1d6 (19-20/x2). If you're fighting critical hit immune monsters then the only difference between these weapons is the base damage type, which is important for DI/DR.

Don't put piercing damage on a rapier or shortsword, it doesn't stack with the extra damage from EB. For the rapier/shortsword (piercing weapon) you should add Bludgeoning and Slashing damage but not Piercing damage. This changes depending on the weapon, so for a mace (bludgeoning weapon) you shouldn't add Bludgeoning damage, and for a handaxe (slashing weapon) you shouldn't add Slashing damage.

Dropping the shield is a very bad idea for this build, you lose 3 feats and (at least) 10 AC in exchange for 2 more attacks per round. If you were planning to work alongside a tank then it would be fine, but if you're soloing then you will need as much AC, concealment, and DI/DR as possible. When I said to focus in two weapons I meant to get AB feats for two different weapons so that you can switch between them, such as getting WF: Mace, EWF: Mace, and Weapon Of Choice: Mace as well as the rapier/shortsword feats. You should still use a shield when using the other weapons.
Personally I recommend carrying multiple weapons with different damage types on servers that are built around DI/DR even if your AB with the other weapons is lower. Your AB with a mace or handaxe would be 7 points lower than your AB with a rapier/shortsword, but the difference in DI/DR could be more important than the loss of AB. For example, let's say you're fighting with a rapier/shortsword but your opponent has 50% Piercing DI and 0% Bludgeoning DI. In that scenario it might be worth switching to a mace even if your AB is lower when using a mace.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: Glad to hear that the build is working well. 99 AC without IExp is a lot higher than I expected, you can probably afford to drop a couple Great DEX feats to pick up Epic Fort + Great Fort. If you also swap the +12 CHA for +12 CON that will result in 48 Fortitude, although I don't know if that will be high enough. If you rebuild it completely then you could also drop the starting DEX to 18 and increase your starting STR and CON slightly.
